name: Ciragan Palace Kempinski Istanbul

reviews.text: First time in Istanbul and had a great time at the Ciragan. We did not get a room that faced the Bosphorus but the noise level was not bad. The room was smaller and darker than I had hoped but we did not spend too much time in the room.
reviews.title: Nice!

reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: dazzling property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Great pool
reviews.title: You only live once

reviews.text: - Helpful staff
reviews.title: Good choice with a few reservations.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Room: love the daily treats they leave you, particularly the powdered chocolate truffles
reviews.title: Extremely Noisy rooms (garden view)

reviews.text: I have to say that I was a bit worried booking my stay here since most reviews make it sound like the hotel is so far out of the way. I am so happy that I booked here, I felt it was pretty much centrally located and easy to get to wherever you want to go! Traffic is a problem in IStanbul so really where ever you stay you will be waiting in traffic jams. It was a great place to come back to night after night. As for the property, the pictures do not do it justice and the staff is what you expect from a hotel of this caliber, extremely attentive and will accommodate any request! I will not stay anywhere else upon my return to Istanbul. The pool was fantastic and again the pool staff was there for any request but never in your face. Cannot wait to come back to Turkey and this fantastic hotel! Oh and btw the TVs are old but if you are coming to this hotel to watch TV then your missing the whole point of a vacation!!
reviews.title: The perfect escape!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a real treat away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Yes, it takes a while to get to and from the Grand Bazaar and the Blue Mosque given the traffic jams all over Istanbul, but the peace and quiet of the hotel, the very nice rooms and the great view let you relax and recover afterwards. The gym is large, the spa fantastic and the food, both quality and selection, superb. The breakfast buffet is the largest and most diverse I have ever seen and is worth splurging out. Like this, everything else does come at a price so, and especially the continental breakfast is NOT worth the money (walk the 10min to the square next to the mosque in Ortakoy instead).
reviews.title: Absolutely 1st class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the second time--by request--and cannot say enough wonderful things about the hotel. We were upgraded to a huge, full Bosphorus view room that we could have lived in for a while! My favorite amenity was the pile of pillows on the bed, each one a little different, with an explanation of each one. I could have watched the traffic on the Bosphorus for hours , but there was so much more to do! It's an exciting place to stay, yet elegant and peaceful. One observation--security is way up there since between the first and second visits, they have added an X-ray machine and security check at the entrance. Our room included breakfast and calling it breakfast is an incredible understatement! We took dozens of pictures, because the selection and presentation was overwhelming! We also were entitled to a magnificent traditional tea, which became our lunch since we weren't really hungry at lunchtime after indulging at breakfast. The first time we sat outdoors and watched the Bosphorus; the second time, we sat inside and listened to lovely piano music. This is a world-class hotel and we hope to return!
reviews.title: Extraordinary hotel with superb service.

reviews.text: We are from NYC, so are used to the hustle of large cities, but Istanbul takes city hassle to a new level. Traffic, crowds and smells are all bigger in this great city. The Ciragan is postitioned perfectly to give you a break from touring the city. The views over the Bosphorus, pool, grounds and buildings are on par with the best anywhere. The hotel looks from outside to be more grand and opulent than the 4 seasons next door, which looked kind of 60s-ish from the outside. Staff was always helpful and accessable. The morning breakfast was probably the best we have had. Certainly best variety. Definitely spend the money to get a Bosphorus facing view.
reviews.title: Needed oasis in this city

reviews.text: Staying at the fabulously located Kempinski hotel in Istanbul was interesting. The views were breathtaking as was the pool right by the Bosphorus. On the other hand, the food was terrible, and the „Do Not Disturb” sign there apparently means „Call every half an hour” :))).
reviews.title: Great location. Average service. Bad food.

reviews.text: I stayed here for work, as we are hosting a conference here later in the year, but managed to squeeze in some relaxation too. The hotel is simply stunning. The location is perfect - on the banks on the Bosphorus. Room was beautiful - super comfy bed, and everything you could want provided. Fabulous bathroom with lovely robes, slippers and toiletries. Breakfast is delicious- probably about 200 things to choose from, but I never did discover what 'Foul Madam' was. There is a juice batr with 10 different juices to choose from. Ate at BBQ restaurant one night - outside by the Bosphorous - which was great. Staff are very friendly, and nothing seems to too much trouble. Pool and spa are beautiful. Only down side - everything is very expensive but I guess you get what you (or your company) pay for and here that is a lot.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now just need a big fat pay rise so I can come back on holiday.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights after one night in Sultanahmet. We made the right choice - one night in the busy hustle and bustle of the old city and then two nights relaxing on the Bosphorus. We didn't go back to the old town once we'd arrived at the Kempinski but just explored further up the coast - Bebek, Sariye - both places worth seeing with Chilai a good restaurant to go to in Bebek. It's a day and evening place so why not let one just run into the other.
reviews.title: If in Istanbul, this is the place
sensational!
reviews.text: The Kempinski is a wonderful hotel, great location and very helpful staff. Nothing was too much trouble. The bars were good fun - liked the Fumoir at night and breakfast was excellent - buffet but all different types of foods. I think they were having an Indian wedding the day we left as that morning there was a new breakfast table offering curries and similar. How clever of a hotel to consider who is staying at their hotel and cater for their tastes.
Well done Ciragan Palace Kempinski and we look forward to visiting you again.
reviews.title: It's a real palace-you would feel like a royal family.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ciragan Palace is on the Bosphorus, some distance by taxi from the main tourist areas. It has a beautiful setting but it feels like a large, impersonal hotel. Our room was nice although a bit dated with a very old TV and décor that needed updating but it overlooked the old palace with a deck and a partial view of the Bosphorus. It is lovely to sit at the restaurant and have a drink and watch the ship traffic. Note that food and drink at the Ciragan is very expensive (probably because there are no other options in walking distance). If I chose to stay on the Bosphorus in the future, however, I would probably stay at the Four Seasons instead as it is a smaller hotel and I think that the service would be better. The Ciragan felt a bit like a convention hotel (there was a convention going on while we were there) and the staff was nice but not top-notch. The breakfast buffet is outstanding and not to be missed although it is quite expensive so be sure that you have a room rate that includes breakfast.
reviews.title: Lovely Setting, Average and Impersonal Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must start by saying that for the first time travelers to Istanbul, staying by the Bosphorus is not the best idea. I recommend staying in Sultanahmet area where you can walk to most important/historic attractions.
reviews.title: Beautiful Bosphorus Views and Promenade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We neither liked or disliked this hotel. It has old world grandeur but I thought it was a bit too much of it in a fake-way. On the other hand, the grounds and promenade right on the Boshphorus and next to the Ciragan Palace (which houses one of the hotel's restaurants) is amazing. The service is fine. The concierge staff are polite but not terribly helpful. We were upgraded to Jr. Suite with river views which was nice. The baths are updated and comfortable. We also dined at Tugra, hotel's award winning restaurant housed in the Ciragan Palace wing. The food was good but not memorable, although the atmosphere was. I also enjoyed a relaxing message at the Spa during our stay.
reviews.title: We shall return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is next door to Four Seasons Boshphorus. There is a pretty park across the hotel and the ferry stop is 15 min. away by walking. However, for visit other tourist attractions, one must use cabs or perhaps the Metro.
reviews.title: Magical!

reviews.text: Bottom line, Ciragan Palace Kempinski is a good luxury hotel choice for staying a night or maximum of 2 in Istanbul.
reviews.title: Great place! From The Sultan Brunch though... all is left is an Azap's snack

aka: Ciragan Palace Kempinski Istanbul Hotel Istanbul
description: The Cıragan Palace Kempinski Istanbul offers the ultimate in luxury and glamour of a genuine Ottoman Palace with its 313 rooms including 22 suites in the hotel and 11 suites in the historical Palace. This 5-star luxury Imperial Palace hotel is located on the shores of the magnificent Bosphorus overlooking the ancient city of Istanbul, provides a one-of-a-kind experience with its historical ambiance and excellent Kempinski service.
